required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Parenteral and Enteral Nutrition on Skeletal Muscle Genomics
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Parenteral and Enteral Nutrition on Skeletal Muscle Genomics

brief_summary.textblock: The study investigates effects related to muscle protein metabolism at provision of Parenteral or enteral nutrition

detailed_description.textblock: Randomized study investigation alterations in muscle protein metabolism at provision of parenteral or enteral (oral drink) nutrition. The study uses a genomic/transcriptomic/proteomic approach to evaluate factors related to activation of skeletal muscle protein synthesis and protein degradation. Patients scheduled for major gastrointestinal surgery are included. Muscle specimens are collected during surgery.

study_design_info.masking_description: Persons responsible for genomic/transcriptomic/proteomics analyses are blinded. All samples are coded.

primary_outcome.description: Alterations in skeletal muscle gene expression quantified by microarray

arm_group.description: Overnight infusion of parenteral nutrition. Supplied as all-in-one-bag format. Infusion rate of 0.2 g N/kg/day.
Oral nutrition drink. 2 * 200 ml on the night before operation. 1* 200 ml on the morning of operation day.
Overnight infusion of crystalloid fluid (Ringer acetate) infused at the same rate (ml/kg) as intervention PN

intervention.description: Overnight infusion of parenteral nutrition. Supplied as all-in-one-bag format. Infusion rate of 0.2 g N/kg/day.
Oral nutrition drink. 2 * 200 ml on the night before operation. 1* 200 ml on the morning of operation day.
Overnight infusion of crystalloid fluid (Ringer acetate) infused at the same rate (ml/kg) as intervention PN

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Major gastrointestinal surgery.
- Assumed need of post-operative nutrition support.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Insulin dependent diabetes.
- Steroid medication.
